p: Izoxazole derivatives exhibiting anti-inflammatory properties are a great group in this class of potential therapeutics [ 17, 43]. Ryng and colleagues focused on the synthesis of 5-amino-3-methyl-4-isoxazolecarboxylic acid as a Î²-amino acid derivative. In an earlier study, the authors demonstrated strong anti-inflammatory and antibacterial activity of p-etoxyphenylamid ( Table 3, Compound 15) and p-chlorophenylamid of 5-benzoylamino-3-methyl-4-isoxazolecarboxylic acid ( Table 3, Compound 16). The most potent activity of these compounds was attributed to the benzoyl group in position 5 of the isoxazole ring [ 44].
